safenet.jcprov.sample
Class Threading

java.lang.Object
  safenet.jcprov.sample.Threading
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Threading
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Sample program to show use of different ways to handle multi-threading.

This progams initialised the Cryptoki library according to the specified locking model. Then a shared handle to the specified key is created. The specified number of threads are started, where each thread opens a session and then enters a loop which does a triple DES encryption operation using the shared key handle.

It is assumed that the key exists in slot 0, and is a Public Token object.

Usage : java ...Threading -numThreads <numthreads> -keyName <keyname> -locking <lockingmodel> -duration >duration< -userPin >userpin< [-v]

  • numthreads number of threads to start
  • keyname name of the Triple DES key to use for encryption operation
  • lockingmodel locking model, one of :- none, OS, functions
  • duration execution time, in seconds
  • userpin user pin for slot 0

    The Thread.

    Each thread should have it's own session, so that the cipher state of the session is not corrupted by other threads.
